original: KOCK, Birger, Civilingenjör, Engby gård, Täby, f Djursholm 11/7 94 av överinsp E K o Anna Åslund, gm Karin Dahlqvist. Whit-lockska samsk, tekn sk:s i Sthlm maskin-yrkessk, KTH (E) 16—19. Ing v fma Stålhane, Kring & Co Sthlm 19, lab.chef v Elektr AB Volta Sthlm 20—21, ing v Cia Sudameri-cana de Teléfonos L M Ericsson i Buenos Aires 22—23, montageing h L M Ericsson i Marocko o Span 24—25, tekn insp h The Chile Telephone Co i Santiago de Chile 26—27, ing v Cia Sudamericana de Teléfonos L M Ericsson i Buenos Aires 28—29, försäljn.chef där 30—31, reklamchef h Telef.AB L M Ericsson Sthlm 32—34, inneh Birger Kock AB, Ing.fma, Sthlm, sed. 35. Sekr i Sv Uppfinnarefrn o Sv Kyltekn Frn, styr.led i Tekn Museet.
translated: KOCK, Birger, Civil Engineer, Engby farm, Täby, born in Djursholm on July 11, 1894, son of Chief Inspector E K and Anna Åslund, married to Karin Dahlqvist. Whitlock School, Technical School in Stockholm, Technical School of Engineering at the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1916 to 1919. Engineer at Stålhane, Kring & Co in Stockholm in 1919, laboratory manager at Elektr AB Volta in Stockholm from 1920 to 1921, engineer at Cia Sudamericana de Teléfonos L M Ericsson in Buenos Aires from 1922 to 1923, assembly engineer at L M Ericsson in Morocco and Spain from 1924 to 1925, technical inspector at The Chile Telephone Co in Santiago de Chile from 1926 to 1927, engineer at Cia Sudamericana de Teléfonos L M Ericsson in Buenos Aires from 1928 to 1929, sales manager there from 1930 to 1931, advertising manager at Telef.AB L M Ericsson in Stockholm from 1932 to 1934, owner of Birger Kock AB, Engineering Firm in Stockholm since 1935. Secretary at the Swedish Inventors Association and Swedish Refrigeration Technology Association, board member at the Technical Museum.
